Okay, so if you're not aware that Abu Dhabi Combat Club has been holding a submission wrestling tournament since the mid 90s.
And so it is now owned and run or managed by Mo Asim.
And his father owns the ADCC organization.
Basically, it is focused on submissions, guys.
The first five minutes, there's no points.
It is a specific rule set that penalizes guard pulling.
Now, you can pull guard in the first five minutes.
But once points start, if you pull guard, you'll be given a negative one point.
Now, everyone who goes in the ADCC has to qualify.
So if you actually make the big show, it's every two years, it's like the Olympics of no-gear grappling.
When I was there in 2019, I couldn't believe I was looking around me like, everyone here is a world champion.
Everyone here is the multiple time champion.
